## Key Differences from Old Workflow

### Before GitHub Environments

```
Push to main
    â”‚
    â”œâ”€â”€â”€ Staging Deploy (automatic)
    â”‚
    â””â”€â”€â”€ Production Deploy (automatic on release) âš ï¸ No approval!
```

### After GitHub Environments

```
PR Created â†’ Staging Deploy (automatic) â†’ Test
    â”‚
    â–¼
Merge to main â†’ Staging Deploy (automatic)
    â”‚
    â–¼
Release PR â†’ Merge
    â”‚
    â–¼
Production Queued â¸ï¸ WAITS FOR APPROVAL
    â”‚
    â–¼
Maintainer Approves âœ…
    â”‚
    â–¼
Production Deploy
```

## Environment Configuration

```

```
Release PR Merged
    â”‚
    â–¼

â”‚                                       â”‚
â”‚  1. Go to Actions tab                 â”‚
â”‚  2. Click running Deploy workflow     â”‚
â”‚  3. See "Review deployments" button   â”‚
â”‚  4. Click button                      â”‚
â”‚  5. Select "production" checkbox      â”‚
â”‚  6. Click "Approve and deploy"        â”‚

â”‚  âœ… GitHub release created            â”‚

## Secret Resolution

```
Workflow needs VITE_API_URL...

1. Check: staging environment secrets
   âœ… Found: https://divergent-flow-api-staging.fly.dev

2. Check: production environment secrets
   âœ… Found: https://divergent-flow-api.fly.dev

Result: Each environment gets its own value!

No more _STAGING/_PROD suffixes needed! ğŸ‰
```

## Cost Control Flow

```
Old Way:
Push to main â†’ Production builds automatically
ğŸ’° Cost: Every push incurs production build cost

New Way:
Push to main â†’ Only staging builds
Release merge â†’ Production queued â¸ï¸
Review changelog â†’ Decide if worth deploying
Approve â†’ Production builds
ğŸ’° Cost: Only when you explicitly approve
```

1. Follow [SETUP-CHECKLIST.md](./SETUP-CHECKLIST.md)
